etymology.description: Originally: 刀(刀) (dāo, 'knife') + 幺(幺) (yāo, 'silk') = to cut silk threads -> Now: semantic 糹(糹) (sī, 'silk') + semantic 刀(刀) (dāo, 'knife') + phonetic 巴(巴) (bā) = 'sever'
etymology.interpretation: The character 絕(jue) combines the imagery of cutting silk threads with a knife, reflecting its meaning of 'sever.' Over time, the phonetic component 巴 was added to specify pronunciation and extend the original concept from literal cutting to the metaphorical sense of 'severing' connections.
etymology.simplification: 糹(糹) (sī, 'silk') was simplified as 纟(丝) in simplified characters, retaining its essence while reducing stroke count.

examples.chinese: 他决然断绝了旧友的联系(他決然斷絕了舊友的聯繫)。
examples.pinyin: Tā juérán duànjué le jiùyǒu de liánxì.
examples.english: He resolutely severed ties with his old friends.

examples.chinese: 她想抛弃过去(她想拋棄過去)，断绝尘世纠葛(斷絕塵世糾葛)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xiǎng pāoqì guòqù, duànjué chénshì jiūgé.
examples.english: She wants to abandon the past and sever entanglements of the mundane world.

examples.chinese: 我必须断绝所有不良影响(我必須斷絕所有不良影響)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bìxū duànjué suǒyǒu bùliáng yǐngxiǎng.
examples.english: I must sever all negative influences.
